data.event: The Logan metropolitan area contained 125,442 people as of the 2010 census.
In 2005 and 2007, Morgan Quitno declared the Logan metropolitan area the safest in the United States.
The town of Logan was founded in 1859 by settlers sent by Brigham Young to survey for the site of a fort near the banks of the Logan River.
Brigham Young College was founded here in 1878 (but later closed), and Utah State University – then called the Agricultural College of Utah – was founded in 1888.

event.title: grew to about 20,000 in the mid-1960s, and by 2010

data.event: Logan grew to about 20,000 in the mid-1960s, and by 2010 its population was approaching 50,000.
